snippet: Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai testified in Manhattan courtroom that he felt he had “no choice” but to sign away his rights after being seized in Libya last year by United States commandos.
abstract: Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, man accused of being an al-Qaeda operative, testifies that he was coerced into waiving his rights after being seized in Libya in 2013 by United States commandos; testimony comes at supression hearing in Federal District Court in Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai testified in Manhattan courtroom that he felt he had “no choice” but to sign away his rights after being seized in Libya last year by United States commandos.

headline.main: Suspected Qaeda Operative Tries to Quash Rights Waiver
headline.print_headline: Man Charged in Bomb Plot Tries to Quash Rights Waiver
